result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Galle #412963 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Immediately eligible for programming.
Concurrent with: 2014CF205

superMiscConds.notes:
Absolute Sobriety. 
Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules/programming of extended supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.
Must follow thru with AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office. Money seized is to go toward costs.

**Money seized is to go toward fines/costs & any balance is to be forfeited.

$300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office. Money seized is to go toward fines/costs.

**Money seized is to go toward fines/costs & any balance is to be forfeited.
